channel.title: Writing text to a text file (VB6)
channel.description:
Hey
I have currently got the following code to try and write whatever is in text1 (textbox) to a text file in in my c drive. Only problem is that it's making the file but it has nothing inside it. Could someone fix this code for me? I currently have:
[code]Private Sub Command1_Click() Dim Text1 As String Text1 = Text1 Open "c:\keys.txt" For Append As #1 Print #1, Close #1 End Sub[/code]
Thanks

item.title: Writing text to a text file (VB6)
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“h44ckzor pwnage, post:1, topic:237420”] Text1 = Text1 [/quote]
that line neednt exist in that state, that would be like writing 5=5 it doesnt need a line of script to tell it that it

Read full topic

h44ckzor pwnage:

Thanks for all your help. One more question though. I’m trying to get a timer to press a command button everyone 60 seconds, I set the interval and I tried the keydown method but it doesn’t work, can someone shed some light on this issue?

Private Sub Timer1_Timer() Command1_Click End Sub
?

item.title: Writing text to a text file (VB6)
item.dc:creator: @Flaming_Idiot Flaming Idiot
item.description:
@Flaming_Idiot wrote:

Two problems. You’re not telling it what to write to the file, and you’re setting the Text1 variable to itself.

Try This:

Private Sub Command1_Click() Dim Text1 As String Text1 = Me.Text1.Text Open "c:\keys.txt" For Append As #1 Print #1, Text1 Close #1 End Sub

Read full topic
item.source: Writing text to a text file (VB6)
